meanings.sent1: The abiological rock formations in the desert were formed over millions of years.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study abiological processes like erosion and crystallization.
meanings.sent3: The abiological clouds seemed to dance across the sky in a whimsical manner.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline at night had an abiological beauty that mesmerized onlookers.
meanings.sent5: The abiological landscape of the moon appeared stark and barren.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to processes or substances that do not involve living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The abiological reaction in the lab produced unexpected results.
meanings.sent2: Chemists often work with abiological compounds in their experiments.
meanings.sent3: The abiological experiment went awry when the chemicals mixed in a comical way.
meanings.sent4: Her abiological approach to problem-solving was both innovative and effective.
meanings.sent5: The abiological nature of the machine made it ideal for sterile environments.
